creator: yjacobson@mannainc.com
text:
I use the following path to get to my servlet:
http://localhost/servlets/testDispatch/START
START is the extra path information.

testDispatch *forwards* the request to servlet2 like this:

final RequestDispatcher dispatcher = getRequestDispatcher("servlet2");
dispatcher.forward(request, response);

If I check the getPathInfo() while I'm in the testDispatch servlet, I get
START. If I check it after I've been forwarded to servlet2 , I still get START 
instead of null.

I think this behavior is diffrent then expected by the servlet spec:
"The path elements of the request object exposed to the target
servlet must reflect the path used to obtain the RequestDispatcher"

from reading the spec i understand that if i forward my request as i wrote 
above i should get null when calling getPathInfo() in servlet2. and if i want 
to keep the PathInfo passed to servlet2 i should write:
getRequestDispatcher("servlet2/"+getPathInfo);

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: Fixed in 3.3. Thanks for the report, it's a spec compatibility issue.
